cards.title: Leviathan
setup: Reveal cards from the top of the villain deck until you reveal a Tactic card. Put it into play. Shuffle the other revealed cards into the villain deck.
gameplay: When {LeviathanCharacter} flips to this side, destroy {H} hero non-character cards.
At the end of the villain turn, {LeviathanCharacter} deals each hero target 2 melee damage.
At the end of the villain turn, if {LeviathanCharacter} was dealt at least {8 - H} damage at once last round, flip {LeviathanCharacter}'s villain character cards.'
flippedGameplay: When {LeviathanCharacter} flips to this side, reveal cards from the top of the villain deck until you reveal a Tactic card. Put it into play. Shuffle the other revealed cards back into the villain deck.
At the start of the villain turn, flip {LeviathanCharacter}'s villain character cards.
flippedAdvanced: The first time {LeviathanCharacter} would flip each turn, play the top card of the villain deck first.

cards.title: Anyone Can Die
body: {LeviathanCharacter} deals the hero target with the highest HP 5 irreducible melee damage.

flavorQuotes.text: Jotun deceased, CD-6. Dauntless deceased, CD-6. Alabaster deceased, CD-6.

cards.title: Cunning
body: Play the top 2 cards of the villain deck.

flavorQuotes.text: Despite the image he might convey, he is not stupid, and he can display a level of cunning and tactics that can and will catch you off guard.

cards.title: Faster Than You'd Think
body: The first time {LeviathanCharacter} would be dealt damage each round, prevent that damage.

flavorQuotes.text: At the speeds Leviathan can move, surface tension and compressibility make water harder than concrete.
The primary message I want to convey, even more than briefing you on the particulars of his abilities, is that I do not want you to underestimate Leviathan.

cards.title: Impossible Endurance
body: At the start of the villain turn, reveal cards from the top of the villain trash until you reveal a One-Shot. Play it. Discard the other revealed cards.
cards.flavorText: The Endbringer stood, showing none of the frailty or pain it had been displaying seconds ago.

cards.title: Impossible Strength
cards.flavorText: Leviathan grasped a car, twisted his entire upper body to toss it in the style of an Olympic hammer-throw.

cards.title: Impossible Toughness
cards.flavorText: Body divided into layers, extending down to hyperdurable core body. Each layer down is slightly more than twice as durable as previous.

cards.title: Lose the War
body: If the environment deck is ever empty, {LeviathanCharacter}'s target has been destroyed. [b]GAME OVER.[/b]
At the start of the villain turn, remove the top card of the environment deck from the game.
Whenever a player skips their play, power, or draw phase, they may move 1 card from the environment trash to the bottom of the environment deck.

flavorQuotes.text: These areas, however, were too vulnerable. Waiting let Leviathan build up the strength of his attacks, and we lost.

cards.title: Tidal Wave
body: {LeviathanCharacter} deals each non-villain target X cold damage, where X is the number of targets destroyed this way plus 1.
cards.flavorText: The forcefields to the left collapsed, and the water began to rush in, carrying chunks of brick, glass and the metal windowframes into the lobby.

cards.title: Torrential Downpour
body: Whenever a player would draw a card, {LeviathanCharacter} first deals that player's hero 1 cold damage.
cards.flavorText: The windows were rattling with the force of the rain against them. It was almost impossible to see through them with the water that streamed down.

cards.title: Water Shadow
body: Whenever {Leviathan} would deal melee damage to a target, this card first deals that target 2 irreducible melee damage.
cards.flavorText: When they were only fifteen feet apart, he stopped, let his water echo rush forward to meet her.

cards.title: Whipping Tail
body: {LeviathanCharacter} deals the 2 hero targets with the lowest HP 2 melee damage each.
cards.flavorText: Leviathan retaliated with a whiplike lash of his tail, bisecting the man. Of the twelve or so that had been on the roof a minute ago, only three remained.
